Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hmm. Pretty well appointed for such a small ship. I can see why Command suggested her as a flag vessel.
It's only natural, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Are you completely sure you're a battleship?
They did mention you used to host a lot of events in New York when you were landbound.
No doubt. What else are you good at?

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, I'll excuse your rudeness once. My 14" guns certainly say I'm a battleship!
Of course, for people of all standings! My American hospitality cannot and will not be beaten.
In addition to being an expert instructor and diplomat, I'm a certified doctor - and a decent orchestral director to boot.
Now that I'm on the water, I think you need a demonstration of my skills!
Oh, Recruit, there you are. What's natural?
To make me a flagship, of course! I'm an expert in all fields of naval warfare - not to mention a delightful hostess for diplomatic functions.
Besides, what fleet commander wouldn't want to ride in style in a New York-class battleship?
What did you have in mind?
The inbound Morgana fleet will suffice for a showcase!
Your senses are definitely up to snuff. Battle stations!
Bring them on! I hope you're paying attention, Captain!
Good timing, Recruit. I just got some dispatches from HQ.
Anything of particular interest? I was hoping we'd get orders to pick up a new batch of recruits to train soon.
@BATTLE
No, but we're already making headlines after that last battle.
As should be expected of us!
Here's one. "Pocket Battleship USS Recruit Engages Enemy..."
Pocket battleship? Surely they must have gotten that wrong!

Fields.MenuText: Really? I thought it was a fairly apt title myself.
Who knows with reporters? They got my name wrong, too.
I wouldn't worry about it too much, Recruit. Your deeds will show them a thing or two.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph. Really, Captain, I think you of all people would know better by now.
The gall! My classification, your name... One only wonders what else they made a pig's ear of.
Hmm... You may be right. What to do, though...
Well. Regardless, this simply won't stand!
I'll see about this, Captain. Don't you worry!
I'm not sure if I should be concerned, or looking forward to the show.
Right this way, folks. Your quarters are down this ladder well.
Recruit, who are these civilians coming aboard?
I wasn't able to get ahold of the reporter responsible for that terrible yellow journalism about me, but I invited a few others to join us for a spell.

Fields.MenuText: Did you not think to ask me before bringing civilians aboard? Or at least tell me?
Wonderful. More reporters. Just what the world needs.
Could we maybe do something more fun instead? Like bombard their papers with strongly worded letters?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm terribly sorry, Captain. Would you mind if I had a few guests? They'll be gone before you know it.
Don't worry about it, Captain. I'll keep them out of the way, and once they're prepared to correct the record, they're gone.
That's my backup plan. Civilians might be slightly alarmed by gunfire, so subtlety first.
You're really angry about that slight, aren't you?
I never get angry, Captain. It's beneath me. I get even.
Of course you do. I--
Captain! Harbormaster's on the radio! Morgana raid!
Well, there's a story for your reporters!
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
Come on, everyone! I'd hate to have her all to myself!
Skipper, the reporters wanted to talk to Recruit after the last engagement.
I hope they got some decent photos, or whatever they were doing. Make sure they're put ashore as soon as possible.
I'm sorry, I mustn't have heard you correctly. Could you please say that again?
Uh-oh.
... Hold that thought.
I was just asking how many ships in your weight class you can be expected to handle.
I did hear that part, but what exactly is my weight class?
You're a gun-heavy super destroyer, obviously, or maybe a light cruiser from Hell. Or Harlem, I guess.
I'm from Manhattan, for one thing. For two, I'm a New York-class battleship, not a light cruiser. So I expect I'd perform on a scale comparable to my elder sisters.
These guns of mine say any Morgana battlewagon that wants to scrap ends up as scrap. You can print that.
Yikes. She was being nice, but there was ice in her voice. What should we do?

Fields.MenuText: It's his own fault for insulting her. Recruit settled things, I think.
Go smooth any feathers she might have ruffled. I don't need Public Affairs on my case.
Obviously I need to go have a talk with our Belle. Something's clearly stuck in her boiler.

Fields.DialogueText: Very well, Captain. They're due to disembark at our next port anyway.
Yes, Captain. I don't relish it, but it'll make Public Affairs and HQ happy.
Better you than me, Captain.
Damn them all. Damn them all to hell! I won't stand for this!
Ah... Recruit?
Oh! Captain. I, ah... I'm sorry for my outburst.
No, it's all right. He did call you a destroyer, and that was uncalled for.
Well... what if he's right? Maybe I am an overgunned destroyer.

Fields.MenuText: I know you don't believe that.
What happened to all that fire a second ago?
People just don't know what to make of you yet. We have to show them.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh. Ever insightful, Captain. Even I'm allowed a moment of self-doubt.
You're right. Letting them get to me won't solve anything.
Yes... yes, we have to show them.
I'm not going to let them sink my spirits!
I'll come up with a plan that will make my point with style.
That's more like it.
*ALARM*
Just as soon as we roast this incoming Morgana fleet!
And just when you needed cheering up. How kind of them.
I know! Truly generous spirits. Shall we go receive our guests, Captain?
Ship's ladies first.
@BATTLE
Watch and learn, sailors! Recruit's up to bat!
@BATTLE
Delightful. Just delightful.
Something good happen, Recruit?
I - or should I say we - have been tasked with a gala at our next port of call.
What's the occasion?
A delegation from one of the minor powers needs to be wined and dined. They're likely going to pledge more resources to the INPF.

Fields.MenuText: Why us, though?
Hmm. Well, I'm sure we'll put on a good show.
Damn. I'll have to get my dress uniform pressed.

Fields.DialogueText: Who else? Hosting members of high society is a specialty of mine.
But of course! I love a chance to use my searchlights for their original purpose.
Already handled! I actually have three for you. With and without medals, and so forth.
Which delegation did you say it was?
Oh, you just focus on the war, Captain. I'll handle this.
I don't doubt it, but I prefer to be kept in the loop. I'd like to at least know whether I'll need an interpreter.
Oh, pick, pick, pick. But you make a fine point. I'll steal one of the crew to help navigate the festivities.
All this noise today. I'm surprised everyone isn't hung over after that party.
You're all on the clock! Move it!
Recruit, what's all this?
Ah, Captain! Just intensifying the drill schedule.
The crew aren't performing to your standards?
They can always be better. I'm training them up for other ships, after all.
The age of wooden ships and iron men may have passed, but I didn't stay wooden. By Washington's wooden teeth, these sailors will be made of steel!

Fields.MenuText: Just don't go overboard with the training. We need them in fighting shape.
Run them harder. They've been slacking a bit recently.
I really don't think I'm asking much when I ask to be included in your planning, Recruit.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, silly me. Slipped my mind. I'll work on it, Captain.
With pleasure, Captain!
Of course not. We're at war, after all.
So what's on the schedule for today?
Gunnery training, general quarters drills, and...
Recruit?
Training's canceled! Enemy squadron inbound! It's the real McCoy, folks!
I suppose there's no training like the real thing.
That's the spirit!
@BATTLE
Another event, another flock of diplomats cluttering the decks.
I understand it's important, but surely the INPF understands that this is a warship?
We have to keep a stiff upper lip about these things. The INPF is built on diplomacy, and we'll need it if we all want to see the oceans free of Morganas.
Yes, Ma'am. You won't hear an argument from me, but between the new training schedules and this finery... well. Never mind.
What about you, Captain? You understand that this is important, don't you?

Fields.MenuText: I understand, but I also understand where she's coming from.
I'd rather be fighting the damn war than doing this dance.
Don't you think we draw this duty a little too often?

Fields.DialogueText: Standing firm in the middle of chaos as always. You're so reliable, Captain.
Anything to avoid a dress uniform, is it?
Anything!
Hmm... we have been assigned to a fair few diplomatic missions recently.
I have an idea! Come with me.
Got another plan you'd like to let me in on?
Picture this. We go find some champagne, maybe have a dance or two... you know, try to enjoy one of these parties instead of just working.
... Hmm. Good plan. Let's raid the food too.
It seems I ought to let you in on the planning more often. Unfortunately, a teensy wrinkle just came up.
I think I can guess. All hands to battle stations! Bosun! Get the guests below!
I've prepared just the place! Everyone follow me, please!
@BATTLE
Now hear this, now hear this. Drill concluded. Stand down from battle stations.
Here, Captain! Good hustle to stations, and the gun crews had their weapons loaded and laid in record time!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Damn it! Get the crew back to their stations!
Sounds like we're making good progress, then.
Oh, I'm pleased as punch.
So you're going to give the crew a break?
Phew, another surprise drill done. Where's Recruit?
Hmm? Beyond the usual breaks in their duty day? I wasn't planning on it.

Fields.MenuText: Have you considered that you might be pushing them too hard?

Fields.DialogueText: Not at all. Hard training is a must to produce superior sailors.

Fields.MenuText: I'm starting to get worried that with all these drills, the crew might end up fatigued during combat.
Recruit... is something going on with you?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm keeping an eye on things, Captain. I won't let our combat performance slip.
Hmm? I feel fine. Why do you ask, Captain?
Recruit, I--
Ah, Captain! We were just looking for you.
Captain. A pleasure to finally make your acquaintance.
Likewise. What can we do for you?
Oh, you've done quite a bit already. The pair of you have been a godsend for the League of Nations.
That said, we do need you to host another reception.
It would be our pleasure.
I knew we could count on you. You should consider coming across to the diplomatic corps. You'd be putting your skills to their best use.
Did he just...

Fields.MenuText: Recruit, let's not do anything hasty.
Don't take it the way he said it. Take it the way he meant it.
Want me to hit him for you? Or is this your fight?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I won't be doing anything hasty, I assure you.
I do believe I am. Hence my irritation.
No... no need for violence, though I appreciate the chivalry all the same.
This won't do! This won't do at all.
Wait! Where are you going?
To schedule more drills!
I have a bad feeling about this.
We've got guests today, people! Give 'em something to gawk at!
@BATTLE
Lieutenant, Chief - to what do I owe the pleasure?
Guess.
Recruit's latest round of drills?
Captain, she's pushing the crew too hard. Between her drills and combat alerts... legitimate and otherwise... it's a bit too much.
The lads and lasses need their sleep, and they're not getting it. The BFs are more than enough trouble without having to fight against our own Belle.
Morale's starting to take a punch to the gut.

Fields.MenuText: How's that affecting the overall mood?
Lieutenant, what's the feeling in the wardroom? Are the officers feeling the same way?
Damn it. I wanted to nip this in the bud.

Fields.DialogueText: Just grumbling. Muttered plans to request transfer. But it's getting louder.
The officers are generally in the same boat. Recruit's nothing if not egalitarian.
Well, we're in the thick of it now, Captain.
Right. I'll handle this. You two reassure the crew.
Believe me, we're trying. She's got a a way of twirling that bat of hers if she thinks she's being undermined...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Right, people! Just like we trained this morning!
Recruit, we need to talk.
And last night. And the morning before...
What was that? "Recruit, I could use some private lessons?" You catch my drift, sailor?
Er... all of it!
@BATTLE
I imagine that's what a parent would sound like when I've been a bad girl. You know, if I had any.
It's about all these drills.
Exquisite timing! I'm just in the middle of working on this next set.
Well, work off of it. These drills have to stop - or at least slow down.
Why, Captain! I need to get the crew ready for--
An early grave, the way we're going. We're on constant alert!
Well, that's war, isn't it?
Drilling is all well and good, and you're literally built for it. But you're driving the crew to desertion.
... Has it really gotten that bad?

Fields.MenuText: It's close. That's why I'm here.
I'm acting on the advice of multiple members of senior staff.
Recruit, I've been concerned since the whole thing started.

Fields.DialogueText: ... And here I've been, ignoring those concerns.
I've really made a mess of things, eh, Captain?
Perhaps we're closing the barn door after the horses have bolted.
I think we both know this isn't really about the crew.
I just... want to be useful. Here on the front lines. I wouldn't be here if I weren't.
And if I'm not... well, the sailors I train can be. Just like in the Great War.
We both know that's not enough for you. Listen, give the sailors and yourself a break. Think up a new plan.
Well, whatever I come up with... it should start with a ration of ice cream with tonight's dinner. It's the least I can do for all the hard work everyone's been doing.
And no night drills for a while. Everyone not on watch gets a full night's sleep.
... One more night drill?
It's that or the ice cream.
You strike a hard bargain. Maybe you should be the diplomat.
No need for that, Recruit. Let's go figure out that ice cream.
Captain, I have a plan! A good one!
I'm all ears, with reservations.
Oh, that's not fair. You haven't even heard it!
It's not you specifically, Recruit. I've just learned to be cautious whenever a Belle mentions having a plan. Lesson one of captain school.
... That's less unfair. You'll like this one, though.
And there's lesson two.
About my... PR issues, shall we say. I've tried to whip this crew into a formidable shape. I think we need to go hunt down a larger Morgana to make it stick.

Fields.MenuText: Are you crazy? You want to go pick a fight with heavy Morganas?
Hmm... That just might work. It'll certainly prove your point.
That's more or less what I was expecting, honestly.

Fields.DialogueText: It's only fair for me to pick on someone my own size, after all.
I'm glad you agree.
See? You know me so well already!
So who's the lucky Morgana you want to hunt down?
Why do you assume I have someone specific in mind?
Because hunting down any old Morgana won't make a big enough headline.
Perceptive. I want to send Cowardice to the bottom.
We'll have to find her first.
*ALARM*
There's the rub. Any of the others would come right to us. She's... a special case.
@BATTLE
What are you all doing in the passageway?
Thank you for your patience, everyone. You may return to your stations!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Recruit took over the radio room. Something about a secure message from intel.
Excellent. Yes... ha! I have her now!
Ah, Captain! Perfect timing. Cowardice is right where we want her.
Cowardice is a predictable sort when she's operating on her own.
One of my graduates back in the 20s is an ONI man now. I called in a favor.

Fields.MenuText: What? How?
Are you sure we can handle this fight? I don't want to lose lives tilting at windmills.
Excellent. Let's get the coordinates to navigation.

Fields.DialogueText: Cowardice is very real, and we can absolutely pound her into scrap.
That's the spirit, Captain!
Alone? As in independent commerce raiding?
Not alone, alone. I mean running a task force as opposed to being dragged along by someone with more of a spine.
Ah, now I see.
I'm looking forward to this, Captain. Put down a menace to society in the short term, give people something to talk about in the long term. It's perfect!
Why, those girls are even giving us a warmup!
Right in your wheelhouse. Battle stations!
Captain! Radio intercepts suggest that Cowardice is close by.
Excellent. Our first catch of the day.
You were half right, Captain. She's been raiding merchant shipping in the region.
You'd think most people would be sticking to convoys by now.
Lots of merchant skippers and masters thought they could escape the Kaiser's wolves in the Great War, too.
But these ones have sharper fangs and more sensitive eyes and ears than any old U-boat.
I'm glad they didn't have the current batch when I was last in service. I'd have lost a lot of friends.

Fields.MenuText: Meaning ships.
You put a lot of young men in uniform, didn't you?
At least they're on our side now.

Fields.DialogueText: Ships and men. I was quite the recruiter, after all.
Twenty-five thousand at least! Enough to crew twenty-eight full-size dreadnoughts!
I fear we'll need all the help we can get before the war's out.
*ALARM*
Right, people, you know the drill. Battle stations! Get me a fix on the enemy!
Pass the word. First gun crew to land a hit on her gets an extra ration of spirits or ice cream. Their choice.
I'd bet a quarter month's pay they'd take the ice cream after sweating in a turret all day.
Covered. I'll gladly take your money, Captain.
Says the noted expert on crew relations.
Purpose built! For now, however...
Right. Mustn't neglect our guests.
@BATTLE
All this ruckus. I take it the reporters have arrived.
I think I can guess who.
As soon as we made port. Someone must have tipped them off about Cowardice.
She really does know how to play the press to her advantage, doesn't she?
I get the feeling she can play whoever she sets her mind to.
Hey! There's a damaged battlecruiser docking at the other end of the port!
And there they go.
Like sharks smelling blood in the water.
The sheer lack of manners they just displayed... appalling. I didn't even finish my sentence.

Fields.MenuText: What can you expect? They're called dogs for a reason.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll take a well-trained dog over one of those mutts any day.

Fields.MenuText: On to a fresh, bloodier story. Like sharks, but less efficient.

Fields.DialogueText: And less fun to deal with.

Fields.MenuText: I take it you're displeased.

Fields.DialogueText: That, my dear Captain, is an understatement.
All right. She can have the spotlight today, but I have not yet begun to fight!
What did she mean by that, do you think?
Who can guess? But I know we're going to need to be ready when we find out.
*ALARM*
Wasn't that enough action for one day? Let's go.
@BATTLE
No. No, this simply won't do.
Recruit, you're talking to yourself out loud again.
My mistake, Captain! I've just been doing some thinking.
Plotting, more like. This about that battlecruiser?
No one likes being upstaged at their own party, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: What's this really about, Recruit?
I didn't take you for a glory hound.
I think you're more upset about that diplomat.

Fields.DialogueText: A bit. He meant well... but he touched a sore spot all the same.
I'm not! Honestly, I'm not. I don't need glory. Not really.
It's not really about the press. It's just...
I want to be recognized as a warship.
Not just an effective recruiting and training tool.
I want to be able to stand next to my sisters proudly... and not need an asterisk next to my name.
I think that's a fair enough desire.
Though I'd wager your sisters are plenty proud of you. You're done quite a lot. Even while you were landlocked.
I know. I'm proud of my skills. Still, I was born a warship. Commissioned a warship.
I know I can fight. You know I can fight. I prove it every day.
Now you want the world to understand that side of you.
I have a story to tell you about that, Captain...
*ALARM*
Only another time.
@BATTLE
Time to do what we all do best!
@BATTLE
She's not going to like this at all.
Not going to like what, Captain?
Ah! Recruit. We just got orders to prepare for a fairly major event.
Define "major."
Apparently some civilians in landlocked neutral countries put a fundraiser together.
How dear of them. We'll be hosting their representatives?
And some INPF national delegates. Reading between the lines, I suspect we'll need a back room for some serious diplomacy.
Sounds about right to me. One meeting is an excellent cover for another, especially for belligerent nations.

Fields.MenuText: You're taking this in remarkable stride.
Disappointed we won't be able to go giant slaying for a bit?
This is going to keep us far busier than I'd like.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Captain. This is one of my talents, after all.
I don't think there's anything in that order that says that, Captain, dear.
Not at all! I'll handle it. Everything will be waiting when we come into port.
I think I have an idea.
Care to share?
No. Not yet. I need to think about it a bit first.
An appropriate centerpiece for this little party of ours to revolve around...
Ice sculpture, maybe?
No, I was thinking more avant-garde and metallic.
Like something made out of scrap metal?
Exactly.
The last battle has settled my mind on the subject of my special centerpiece, Captain.
Oh? Do share.
Treason's head on a platter.
Like... *the* Treason?
Is there any other? Overgunned battlewagon, red eyes and hair, named for one of the greatest sins of mankind...
You know, I can't say I'm surprised to hear you suggesting this.

Fields.MenuText: So how are we going to find Treason?
Do we need to pierce a maelstrom to find her?
This is absolutely insane. You know that, right?

Fields.DialogueText: The same way we found our dear friend Cowardice.
No, that's a bit much for a personal vendetta.
I'm just picking on someone my own size, is all.
I was waiting for your approval to call my ONI friend.
Well, thank you for that courtesy, at least. Do it.
At once, Captain. Trust me, Treason won't know what hit her.
Does this happen to remind you of a story?
*ALARM*
Ooh, infuriatingly enough... yes. Yes, it does.
@BATTLE
Got a moment, Captain?
Of course. Is it Treason?
No, not yet, though it's just a matter of time. I believe you asked for that story.
I thought I'd never hear it.
Picture it, Captain. Ancient Rome. A great general... A glorious soldier... A man named Gnaeus Domitius Corbulo.
For all his victories, all his glory, his emperor Nero feared his popularity.
Nero demanded that Corbulo fall upon his own sword. Ever loyal, ever faithful, Corbulo obeyed.
His last act was to cry out "Axios!" "Worthy." Loyal to the last. Worthy to the last.

Fields.MenuText: I think I understand where you're coming from now.
It never ceases to amaze me what horrible things petty men can do to others.
I swear, if this is a prelude to all of us getting killed by Treason, we will have words in hell.

Fields.DialogueText: Not at all, Captain. We'll just be visiting Treason.
A lesson all of mankind has yet to truly learn. Perhaps we might yet teach them.
As expected of my captain!
I want to be able to look up at the world and say I am worthy, and know it in my heart. Not for their sake, or for my sisters... but for my own.
I will proudly carry the torch forward for my nation, for humanity. I am worthy. All I ask is that you help me show them that I am.
It's almost a shame you didn't make this speech to the whole crew. They'd shred Treason with their bare hands.
I can only show this side of me to you. They mustn't see either of us doubt.
*ALARM*
Well, they won't start now.
@BATTLE
Stations, everyone! I'll show you the way!
@BATTLE
Captain, I need your signature on this budget for the gala.
Gah! This isn't coming out of our budget, is it?
Not at all! The State Department's paying, but it still requires a senior officer's approval.
Whew, nearly gave me a heart attack. Sure, I'll sign it.
This is everything, then?
Yes. I'll transmit this authorization code at the top and shore parties will handle the final arrangements.
Sounds simple enough. Then everything will be staged near our assigned pier?
You really did pay attention to my briefing. Excellent, Captain!
Captain! Ma'am! Priority transmission from intel.
Thank you. Dismissed.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Hmm...

Fields.MenuText: We have her now.
Well, how kind of Treason to show up on schedule.
The entertainment's confirmed. The party can finally start.

Fields.DialogueText: What's a proper soiree without fireworks?
All according to plan.
We do? Ha! Intel came through. Only one thing to do now.
I'll make the order to alter course. Send that code, then make sure we're in full fighting trim.
We'll be ready. We're worthy. Now we're going to prove it.
Anything?
I... yes. It's Treason, I'm sure of it! Helm, make your course 320, ahead full.
@BATTLE
Bosun, sound general quarters. Surface action to starboard. Let's go battleship hunting.
As expected. Excellent work, people.
Secure from general quarters, I want a damage report yesterday. Lieutenant, you have the conn.
Recruit, with me.
Thoughts, while we're away from prying ears?

Fields.MenuText: I can't believe something that big actually floats.
That was a lot of damn ship to scrap.
From the look on Treason's face, I don't think we made a new friend just now.

Fields.DialogueText: The physics all check out, but it is still a bit mind-boggling. And the size of her guns!
Yet scrap her we did.
The would-be embodiment of Treason holding a grudge? I simply can't imagine. She seems like such a gentle fiendish abomination.
Shame we couldn't get a souvenir, though.
Oh, but we did. One of the sailors is an amateur photographer. I had him take lots of photos.
Going to leak them to the papers?
Tied up in a goddamn ribbon. Ought to be the talk of the gala.
They'll certainly be a feather in the INPF's cap and yours.
Ours, but yes. I want the INPF to benefit as well. We're all in this together, after all.
Well, if anyone doubts your worthiness now, they're fools.
They always were, but now I have hard evidence.
Thank you, Captain. You really helped me make this happen.
Any time.
I swear I've spent more time on the radio than doing literally anything else recently.
What's the problem?
This event is proving more troublesome than Treason.
Nothing I can solve with a salvo, unfortunately.
Mostly it's just logistics. Guests-to-work timing. Food and drink.
I'm going to make it happen, but it's wildly frustrating.

Fields.MenuText: Is there anything we can be doing?
I suppose we could try to make some cargo runs.
Why do they even hold these events on ships?

Fields.DialogueText: Not really, Captain. We've done all we can. It's in other hands now.
No, it's all right. I've rerouted some things over land, but it'll be close...
Me, of course. The Belles. We're a hard story to believe... until you meet us.
On the plus side, an opportunity to destress is presenting itself.
Should I guess? Or just order the ship to general quarters?
The latter, of course. Poor things think they're ambushing us.
Like a sheep catching a tiger in its den.
@BATTLE
Hmm... Mutton for the next gala, definitely.
Captain! I finally broke free from the ambassadors. Are you enjoying yourself?
I swear this dress uniform is more starch than fabric.
Well, you look magnificent in starch. We should get you a saber, though.
Where from? The 1800s?
Oh, it's hardly practical, but it impresses the civilians.
And it would lend you a degree of swagger to distinguish yourself from those swaggerless admirals.

Fields.MenuText: Here I thought my roguish good looks did that.
I suppose I could get an eye patch and a parrot too.
I doubt anyone needs a sword to know my buckle is swashed.

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps, but I believe any officer is improperly dressed without their sword.
Hmm... a red macaw would be a nice splash of vibrant color.
Errol Flynn could stand to take lessons from you, I'm sure.
Still, all things considered, I think everything went well.
Shame about the fireworks, though.
Agreed. I think everyone was looking forward to the show.
*ALARM*
Perhaps we'll have some fireworks after all.
Still got that amateur photographer handy?
He'd be below right about now.
Can't win them all. Get the civilians there too!
@BATTLE
Captain! Have you seen the newspapers? Here!
What? I haven't had time to read a paper. Which one?
Front page of the Times! Here, take my copy.
"... Photos obtained of USS Recruit... engaged with the Morgana battleship known as Treason!"
More importantly, I would have frowned on it.

Fields.MenuText: Recruit, I think I can safely say this is the start of a beautiful friendship.
Damn right it was. I can't wait to see what we conquer together next.

Fields.DialogueText: Damn, those are some good photos. That sailor really risked his neck to get those shots from out on deck.
He's been reprimanded for that, actually. I wanted photos, but Command would have frowned on another dead sailor to consign to Davy Jones.
He survived, didn't he?
But that's all settled. This was quite the adventure, wasn't it, Captain?
And to think this all started with me putting you through your paces at OCS!
Hardly, Captain. This has been a beautiful friendship since long before we put Treason down.
Now... I believe I owe you a reward.
The Morganas couldn't handle one of us. Together... they might as well surrender now!
Huh? I don't remember making that deal.
It's implicit. I'm an instructor and you're my star pupil, after all.
Extra ration of ice cream sound good to you?
Thought you'd never ask.
